procedure: If you lose money through an online payment app, UPI transfer, or bank fraud, call 1930 immediately to request a transaction freeze before it is withdrawn.

crime_type: Social Media Harassment or Cyber Bullying
procedure: If someone is threatening, blackmailing, or spreading false content through social media, take screenshots and URLs, and file a report on the National Cyber Crime Reporting Portal.

crime_type: Online Sexual Exploitation or Child Abuse (CSAM)
procedure: Report any explicit or abusive online content involving minors immediately through the 'Women/Child Related Crimes' section of the National Cyber Portal.

crime_type: Identity Theft / Fake Social Media Profile
procedure: If your photo, account, or identity is misused on any digital platform, report the account to the platform and then lodge a complaint on the Cyber Crime Portal.
If you paid online for goods or services and were cheated, contact the platformâ€™s support first. If unresolved, register a cyber fraud complaint online.
Disconnect your device from the internet immediately. Do not delete any files or messages. Report to your nearest Cyber Crime Police Station for assistance.
If you are being harassed or your data is misused by an unapproved loan app, report on the portal with screenshots and app details.
